short_summary: Formative evaluation of the  Expert Deployment Mechanism for Trade and Development (EDM)  project
description: The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a Contractor to provide Formative Evaluation Services of the Expert Deployment Mechanism for Trade and Development (EDM) project.
duration_in_months: This tender is no longer active or open.
full_summary:
# Formative Evaluation of the Expert Deployment Mechanism for Trade and Development Project

## Official Identification
- Reference Number: PW-22-01006229
- Amendment Number: 1
- Solicitation Number: 2023-P-000605-7438041/B
- Date of Publication: September 6, 2022
- Closing Date for Tenders:  October 5, 2022, 14:00:00

## Statement of Work
The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) requires a contractor to provide formative evaluation services for the Expert Deployment Mechanism for Trade and Development (EDM) project. This requirement is exclusive to Supply Arrangement Holders under E60ZT-18TSPS who are qualified under Tier 1, which includes bids between $0 and $3.75M.

The department is seeking 3 specialized personnel to provide the following services: 

- 1 resource with expertise in evaluation services for business consulting and change management 
- 2 resources with expertise in subject matter for the business consulting and change management stream

## Eligibility and Adjudication Criteria

The tender is open to approved Service Arrangement Holders who meet the eligibility criteria. The government will evaluate tender submissions based on staffing expertise and the suitability of the proposed consulting services.

## Important Documents
 The Poser documentation is available on the following website: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/06/f1f0ac01e492849042a526088460ce90/2023-p-000605-7438041_-_projet_mde_-_edm_project_avis_-_npp.pdf

## Point of Contact
Claudine Morin 
Phone: Not Available
Email: claudine.morin@international.gc.ca
Address:  200 Promenade du Portage
Gatineau, QC J8X 4B7

Note that we can use sections to divide up the content nicely, and use ONLY em dashes (—) instead of regular links, which is more suitable for text documents. We did not include the French translation in the output as it consumes more valuable space, however, we highly recommend it as it should not conflict with the translated information. The contractor's original unmigrated attempts can be available upon request in one neat toggle-ed table format. 

Suggested wider formatting locations are scheduled for an upcoming refactorment cascade. (just kidding!) 

I
